edge_notes.LVFAILURE -> HISTORY: Plausible causal link based on clinical history preceding left ventricular failure.
edge_notes.LVFAILURE -> LVEDVOLUME: LV failure can lead to increased left ventricular end-diastolic volume.
edge_notes.HYPOVOLEMIA -> LVEDVOLUME: Hypovolemia reduces LVEDVOLUME, consistent with physiology.
edge_notes.LVEDVOLUME -> CVP: Increased LVEDVOLUME can increase central venous pressure.
edge_notes.LVEDVOLUME -> PCWP: LVEDVOLUME is a primary determinant of pulmonary capillary wedge pressure.
edge_notes.BP -> TPR: Blood pressure is influenced by total peripheral resistance.
edge_notes.PULMEMBOLUS -> PAP: Pulmonary embolus increases pulmonary artery pressure.
edge_notes.MINVOLSET -> VENTMACH: Setting of minimum volume influences ventilator operation.
edge_notes.VENTMACH -> VENTTUBE: Ventilator machine output affects tubing status.
edge_notes.KINKEDTUBE -> PRESS: Kinked tube can cause pressure alarms.
edge_notes.INTUBATION -> VENTLUNG: Intubation alters lung mechanics and ventilator interaction.
edge_notes.INTUBATION -> MINVOL: Intubation can affect minimum volume delivery.
edge_notes.INTUBATION -> VENTALV: Intubation can affect ventilator valve operation.
edge_notes.VENTALV -> PVSAT: Ventilator valve status affects peripheral saturation.
edge_notes.VENTALV -> ARTCO2: Ventilator valve status affects arterial CO2.
edge_notes.ERRLOWOUTPUT -> HRBP: Low output alarms can influence heart rate and blood pressure.
edge_notes.HR -> HRBP: Heart rate is a direct input to blood pressure.
edge_notes.ERRCAUTER -> HREKG: Electrosurgery can interfere with EKG heart rate detection.
edge_notes.HR -> HREKG: Heart rate is a direct input to EKG-derived HR.
edge_notes.ERRCAUTER -> HRSAT: Electrosurgery can interfere with saturation-derived HR.
edge_notes.HR -> HRSAT: Heart rate is a direct input to saturation-derived HR.
